page.title: 11New Orton Estates
page.content: The new Ortons have come about as a result of the New Towns Act of Parliament in the mid 1960's and this designated Peterborough a New town and charged it with providing housing, industry and facilities for those who wished to move out of London. The first of the new Peterborough Townships was Bretton, and Orton was the second. Orton is designed round five neighbourhoods, each having a school, shops and a pub. The housing is a mixture of privately built and owned houses and those built by the Development Corporation. The houses are deliberately desinged to be different heights and sizes alongside each other the make the effect interesting - like an old village. Many are built round courts to encourage community feeling. Thousands of trees and shrubs have been planted.
